title: 'Lenient' punishment: Former Pak PM Imran, wife Bibi sentenced to 17 yrs in prison
content: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi have been sentenced to 17 years in prison each in the Toshakhana corruption case. The verdict, delivered by an accountability court, pertains to alleged fraud involving state gifts received from the Saudi government in 2021. Both were fined Rs 10 million.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Hindu man Dipu Chandra Das' lynched, body burnt in Mymensingh; 7 arrested
content: Seven arrests were made after a Hindu youth was beaten to death and his body set ablaze in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district following blasphemy allegations. The victim, Dipu Chandra Das, was accused of making derogatory comments. This incident follows the recent killing of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, sparking renewed unrest and political instability.

title: 'Cutting the queue': AI Express grounds pilot over assault on passenger
content: In a dramatic turn of events at Delhi airport, an Air India Express pilot found himself grounded after supposedly attacking a passenger amidst a scuffle over a security queue. The passenger described the ordeal, sharing how he emerged with a bloodied face before the pilot’s scheduled flight to Bengaluru.

title: Dense fog in Delhi: Over 100 flights cancelled at IGI Airport
content: Dense fog disrupted flight operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Saturday, leading to over 100 cancellations. The national capital also experienced a deterioration in air quality, with the AQI reaching 384 in the 'very poor' category, blanketing the city in toxic smog.

title: One of things that Amazon is particularly bad at is ..., says CEO of one of Amazon's biggest biz
content: AWS CEO Matt Garman admitted the company struggles with copying competitors, preferring to innovate from first principles to solve customer problems.  Meanwhile, AWS reported a 20% revenue increase in Q3 2025, exceeding expectations and driven by strong demand in AI and core infrastructure, with significant capital expenditures allocated to AI projects.

title: Watch: US strikes over 70 targets in Syria; calls it 'declaration of vengeance'
content: US launched a major military operation in Syria. Over seventy Islamic State targets were hit with more than one hundred precision munitions. This action follows the recent killing of two American personnel in a December 13 attack. ​Trump said the strikes were part of "Operation Hawkeye Strike" and warned any group threatening Americans of severe consequences.

title: Fossil fuel peak demand pushed to 2030s as oil rebounds; India emerges as growth engine
content: Global oil demand reversed its predicted decline in 2025, with India emerging as a major consumption driver. This resurgence was fueled by delayed clean energy policies and geopolitical tensions, while India diversified its oil imports, notably from Russia, and expanded refining capacity. Stable oil prices provided fiscal relief for importers like India.

title: Musk becomes highest-paid CEO after court reverses 2018 pay-plan ruling; read the order
content: Elon Musk's colossal $56 billion Tesla pay package from 2018 has been reinstated by Delaware's Supreme Court, overturning a lower court's decision. The court awarded nominal damages, recognizing Musk's entitlement to the stock-based compensation now valued at approximately $140 billion, solidifying his position as the world's highest-paid CEO.

title: Assam tragedy: Rajdhani Express hits herd of elephants, killing 8; engine, 5 coaches derail
content: Eight elephants tragically died after being struck by the Sairang New Delhi Rajdhani Express in Assam's Hojai district early Saturday. The collision caused five coaches and the engine of the train to derail, though no passengers were injured. The incident occurred in a forested area known for elephant movement.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Cops initiate process for blue corner notice against Surinder Kumar Khosla
content: Goa Police are initiating the process to issue a Blue Corner Notice against British national Surinder Kumar Khosla, an accused in the December 6 nightclub fire that killed 25. Khosla, believed to be a co-owner of the nightclub, was present in Goa during the incident and reportedly fled to the UK the following day.

title: India’s telecom sector surges in 2025! 5G rollout reaches 85% of population
content: India's telecom sector concluded 2025 with significant advancements in digital connectivity and infrastructure. The National Broadband Mission 2.0 accelerated high-speed internet access nationwide, while 5G services now reach nearly the entire population. A major achievement includes developing indigenous 4G technology, bolstering India's self-reliance and manufacturing capabilities.

title: Google alerts staff: Avoid travelling abroad; 12-month visa delay could leave workers stuck
content: Google has advised US-based employees on certain visas, including H-1B, to avoid international travel due to significant visa stamping appointment backlogs at US embassies and consulates. These delays, reportedly up to 12 months, are linked to new social media vetting rules enforced by the Department of State, prioritizing thorough vetting over speed.

title: Hardik Pandya breaks Yuvraj Singh's long-standing record
content: Hardik Pandya has set a new T20I record for India, surpassing Yuvraj Singh with the most instances of scoring a half-century and taking a wicket in the same match. His explosive 63 off 25 balls and a crucial wicket against South Africa earned him Player of the Match, contributing to India's series win.

title: Sreenivasan no more: Celebs mourn the loss of the legend
content: Veteran Malayalam actor, writer, director, and producer Sreenivasan has passed away at 69, leaving a void in the industry. Celebrities like Prithviraj Sukumaran, Basil Joseph, Tovino Thomas, and Indrajith Sukumaran mourned the loss of the honest storyteller. Known for impactful films like 'Vadakkunokkiyanthram', his legacy will endure.

title: UP: Man performs chin-ups hanging from bridge; video viral
content: A man performing a dangerous stunt from a railway bridge in Hapur, Uttar Pradesh, has captured viral attention. The video depicts him suspended above moving traffic, repeatedly performing chin-up-like movements from the metal structure of the overbridge. Vehicles continued to pass underneath him during the entire stunt.

title: 5 Zodiac signs that will leave struggles behind by year-end
content: With the year's end on the horizon, cosmic energies bring an uplifting wave for some zodiac signs. Aries is charged up to pursue their greatest aspirations, while Cancer discovers a comforting emotional refuge and better-defined limits. Virgo can finally silence the noise of overthinking and bask in the accolades for their hard work.

title: Sreenivasan’s Passing: Malayalam icon’s top screenplays stream online; fans revisit classics
content: Veteran filmmaker Sreenivasan, celebrated for his writing, directing, and acting, has passed away at 69. His legacy includes iconic films like 'Odaruthammava Aalariyam,' a 1984 comedy, and the popular comedy-drama 'Sanmanassullavarkku Samadhanam.' Audiences can revisit his memorable performances and sharp screenplays, including the beloved duo in 'Nadodikkattu' and the comical detective caper 'Pattanapravesham,' on various streaming platforms.

title: Jharkhand: Hit by arrows, jumbos retaliate; 6 killed as victims unaware of herd in dense fog
content: Fears grip Ramgarh as rampaging elephant herds have claimed six lives in three days. Two more villagers were trampled to death on Friday, with forest officials attributing the aggressive behavior to a retaliatory attack after an elephant was injured. The jumbos, part of a larger herd, are disrupting life and mining operations across the district.

title: Nurse gang-raped after knocking on wrong hotel room; 3 arrested
content: A 30-year-old nurse was allegedly gang-raped by three men in a hotel room in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar after she mistakenly knocked on their door. The accused, including two recovery agents and an MBA student, were arrested and remanded in police custody. The victim had gone to meet a friend for financial assistance when the incident occurred.

title: Chennai fire scare: Blaze engulfs BSNL office on Anna Salai; services disrupted
content: A fire erupted at the BSNL office on Anna Salai Saturday morning. The blaze started on the second floor and spread to other levels. Firefighters battled the flames for over an hour. The incident caused a temporary disruption to TANGEDCO online payment services and damaged backup servers for the 108 ambulance service. Investigations are ongoing to determine the exact cause.

title: German couple detained for 'illegal religious conversions' near Indo-Pak border; 4 others held
content: Six individuals, including a German couple, were detained in Sriganganagar for alleged illegal religious conversions. The group was found in a rented house in Srikaranpur, a town near the India-Pakistan border. Authorities are investigating the German nationals' presence in a restricted border zone without authorization.

title: Virat Kohli returns; Rishabh Pant to lead Delhi in Vijay Hazare Trophy — Full squad
content: The DDCA has, however, not included Rishabh Pant, Virat Kohli, and Harshit Rana in the official 16-member squad, as they will only be available for limited matches — likely two to three — before India’s ODI series against New Zealand, starting January 11, 2026. The exact fixtures in which Kohli and Pant will play are yet to be confirmed.

title: SC gives protection to Bulandshahr girl and her mother
content: The Supreme Court swiftly responded to a young advocate's tearful plea, who alleged her uncle was harassing her and her mother over ancestral property. The bench, led by CJI Surya Kant, ordered immediate legal aid, protection for the duo, and restrained the uncle from alienating property, emphasizing the poor's right to judicial time.

title: Harassed at gunpoint: Minor students forced to shoot compromising video in Jharkhand
content: Two school students visiting a waterfall in Koderma were allegedly harassed at gunpoint by two unidentified men. The accused forced the minors into compromising positions, filmed them, and demanded Rs 10,000, threatening to release the video. The students managed to transfer Rs 4,635 before the culprits fled.

title: India T20 World Cup 2026 squad announcement: Time, date, venue and live streaming details
content: India's squad for the 2026 T20 World Cup and the New Zealand series is set to be announced on Saturday. The leadership duo of captain Suryakumar Yadav and vice-captain Shubman Gill is expected to retain their spots despite a challenging year. Suryakumar has managed 213 runs in 18 innings at an average of 14.20 with no fifties, while Gill has scored 291 runs in 15 innings at an average of 24.25 and remains without a fifty since his T20I return.

title: South Delhi bizman shot 69 times: Another businessman’s family suspected behind killing
content: A brutal daylight shooting in Delhi saw businessman Ratan Kumar gunned down 69 times. Police suspect a revenge plot orchestrated by overseas gangsters, linked to the murder of another businessman allegedly by Kumar's estranged son, Deepak. The family believes this was retaliation, despite Kumar publicly disowning his son.

title: Anthony Joshua knocked out Jake Paul in round six to claim a hard-earned victory
content: Anthony Joshua ended Jake Paul’s biggest test with a decisive sixth-round knockout Friday night in Miami. The former heavyweight champion dropped Paul four times, wearing him down with pressure and power before finishing the fight. Paul showed resilience but struggled against Joshua’s size and experience. Afterward, both fighters exchanged respect, with Joshua praising Paul’s effort and composure.

title: Bengaluru horror: Doctor molested while returning home at midnight after duty
content: A 28-year-old doctor was molested by a bike-borne miscreant near Soladevanahalli in Bengaluru late Wednesday night. The accused stopped her under the guise of asking for directions before touching her inappropriately. Police are investigating, using technical tools to trace the suspect despite a partial license plate mismatch.

title: Delaware top court restores Elon Musk's record $55bn Tesla pay package
content: Elon Musk has secured a significant legal victory as the Delaware Supreme Court reversed a lower court's decision, reinstating his $55–56 billion Tesla pay package. The court found the original ruling went too far in cancelling the compensation, despite acknowledging concerns about Musk's influence over the company.

title: Will India and South Africa meet in 2026 T20 World Cup final? Shukri Conrad hopes so
content: South Africa coach Shukri Conrad deemed the India tour successful despite a T20I series loss, expressing hope for a rematch in the next T20 World Cup final. Conrad, who faced criticism during the second and final Test in Guwahati for using the word ‘grovel’, also reflected on the learning experience of touring India.

title: ‘Scared to death': B'desh newspaper goes unpublished for first time; editor recounts 'darkest night'
content: Violence erupted in Dhaka following the fatal shooting of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi. Hundreds of his supporters allegedly set fire to the offices of Prothom Alo and The Daily Star newspapers. The executive editor described it as a "darkest night" for the media, with journalists forced to flee.

title: Couple of peak-hour flights to be moved to Navi Mumbai to ease congestion
content: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA), opening December 25, will initially have higher user development fees than Mumbai airport. Adani Group aims for a unified tariff, making prices comparable soon. NMIA will also help alleviate Mumbai's severe capacity constraints by shifting some peak-hour flights.

title: Noted Malayalam actor-director Sreenivasan passes away at 69 in Kochi
content: Malayalam cinema mourns the loss of veteran actor, writer, and director Sreenivasan, who passed away at 69. Celebrated for his honest narratives, sharp wit, and social commentary, he gave voice to the common man. His iconic films, blending humor with profound messages, and his natural acting style, leave an indelible mark on the industry.

title: ‘Dhurandhar’ box office day 15: Ranveer Singh–Akshaye Khanna starrer continues to reign
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has achieved remarkable success, dominating the box office for 15 days. The film has already crossed Rs 730 crore globally, with an impressive Rs 483 crore net collection in India. Even with new releases, 'Dhurandhar' continues to hold its number one position.

title: Guwahati airport gets new terminal! PM Modi to inaugurate today - see stunning pics
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Guwahati's new Lokapriya Gopinath Bardoloi International Airport terminal today, a significant infrastructure upgrade for Assam. This nature-themed facility, featuring a 'Sky Forest' with indigenous plants, aims to enhance passenger experience and boost commerce and tourism. The terminal is designed to handle millions of passengers annually, incorporating modern digital features for efficient travel.

title: T20 World Cup | India think tank’s top priority: Keeping Bumrah and Pandya fresh
content: With a 50-day countdown to the 2026 T20 World Cup, India’s think-tank has made workload management its top priority, ring-fencing Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya. Bumrah will skip the New Zealand ODIs, while Pandya’s domestic appearances will be carefully rationed, as the management prioritises peak fitness and continuity in T20Is over all other formats.

title: Winter​‍​‌‍​‍‌​‍​‌‍​‍‌ immunity-boosting foods: What to eat to stay well when temperature drops
content: Boost your winter immunity with nutrient-rich foods that support your immune system and combat respiratory infections. Experts highlight micronutrients and live microbes found in citrus, leafy greens, fermented dairy, and zinc-rich seeds, which can reduce infection risk and duration. Incorporating these foods into your diet provides essential vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants for your body's defense.

title: Hardik Pandya's monster hit injures cameraman; ice pack, hug follow - WATCH
content: Hardik Pandya's explosive 63 off 25 balls powered India to a 30-run victory and a 3-1 series win against South Africa. His rapid half-century and a crucial partnership with Tilak Varma set a massive target. Pandya's sportsmanship, checking on a cameraman hit by his six, also drew praise. Varun Chakravarthy's four wickets sealed the win.

title: Who is Sibley Scoles? Netflix ringside reporter at Jake Paul vs Joshua
content: Sibley Scoles emerged as a standout during Netflix’s broadcast of Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua, impressing viewers with her confident ringside reporting. An Emmy-winning broadcaster, Scoles is known for her work with the Las Vegas Raiders, E! News, and major live events. Her appearance introduced a global audience to a seasoned media professional comfortable on the biggest stages.

title: Inside Josh Allen’s luxury car collection: Bills QB’s impressive garage
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.

title: Bret Hart & Stephanie Washington net worth 2025: Wrestling legacy and assets
content: Bret Hart, known as "The Hitman," has amassed a net worth of $7 million through his successful wrestling career with WCW and WWE, merchandise, and royalties. He married his third wife, Stephanie, in 2010, and their joint assets include their Alberta home. Despite a significant age gap, Stephanie has supported Hart through his health challenges.

title: Randi Mahomes thanks fans after Patrick Mahomes’ knee surgery message
content: Patrick Mahomes’ mom sends message after Chiefs QB’s surgery as the Kansas City quarterback begins rehab following a torn ACL and LCL. Randi Mahomes thanks fans for prayers and support while Patrick Mahomes shares an emotional response to the injury. Here is what the Mahomes family said and what the timeline looks like for the Chiefs moving forward.

title: Udupi-Chikkamagaluru MP Kota Srinivas Poojary demands greenfield expressway between Talapady in Dakshina Kannada and Karwar in Uttara Kannada
content: Raising the issue under Rule 377 in the Lok Sabha, the MP says existing four-lane Kochi-Panvel NH 66 has become highly congested resulting in accidents and fatalities

title: Kerala SIR: Citing inaccuracies in ASD list, political parties demand extension of SIR schedule
content: Demand comes on the heels of Supreme Court asking ECI to take a sympathetic view of representations seeking more time

title: Global pecking order has undergone a significant change, says Jaishankar
content: "No country, however powerful, can impose its will on all issues,” Mr. Jaishankar said, addressing the 22nd convocation of the Symbiosis International (Deemed University) in Pune

title: Low visibility prevents PM’s helicopter from landing in Taherpur, Modi returns to Kolkata airport
content: The PM’s chopper made a U-turn after hovering over the helipad ground for a while and returned to the Kolkata airport

title: How South Asians became targets of racist hate on Elon Musk’s X | Explained
content: Racism and hate against South Asians on the basis of their skin colour, religious beliefs, careers in America, and migration history spread unchecked on Elon Musk’s X this year

title: Fire breaks out at BSNL office on Anna Salai in Chennai
content: Due to the fire, thick black smoke engulfed parts of the Anna Salai area, causing inconvenience to motorists

title: Malayalam film stalwart Sreenivasan’s legacy: A timeline
content: Malayalam film veteran Sreenivasan passed away due to ailments on December 20, 2025. Here is a look at his journey in film.

title: PM Modi to address first political rally in Bengal after draft roll release amid SIR concerns of Matuas
content: In the draft electoral rolls published after the enumeration phase, 58,20,899 names have been excluded, reducing the electorate to 7.08 crore

title: Tributes pour in for actor Sreenivasan
content: Sreenivasan’s scripts were milestones of Malayalam cinema; his style was to force one to think through humour

title: From Poland to Pavanayi: How Sreenivasan’s dialogues became Kerala’s meme currency
content: There are countless dialogues from films written by Sreenivasan that have become a rage on social media decades after their release

title: Goa nightclub fire: Police initiate process for Blue Corner Notice against Khosla who fled to U.K.
content: Police have so far arrested eight people, including the nightclub owners Saurabh Luthra, Gaurav Luthra, and Ajay Gupta, and five others

title: Take strict action against travel agents cheating people on pretext of sending them abroad: U.P. CM
content: U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath asked administrative and police officers to ensure time-bound, impartial and quality disposal of complaints and to provide immediate relief to every victim

title: ‘We shared a strong bond’: Filmmaker Sathyan Anthikad remembers his longtime friend and collaborator Sreenivasan
content: Sathyan Anthikad expresses profound sorrow following the passing of Sreenivasan and reflects on their partnership that shaped Malayalam cinema. Anthikad describes their relationship as ‘special’

title: Sreenivasan, a Thalassery legend, becomes part of history
content: Politically aware and inclined towards the arts, Sreenivasan rooted his stories in villages and marinated them in earthy humour

title: Scheme for citizens to obtain khata services from home launched by Karnataka CM
content: Urban Development and Town Planning Minister Byrathi Suresh said 6,119 beneficiaries have been identified under the Gruha Bhagya Scheme, with ₹326 crore released and 4,159 houses completed so far

title: Sreenivasan: the satirist who made Kerala laugh, think, and remember
content: Known for his sharp political commentary and memorable characters, Sreenivasan’s work, including collaborations with notable filmmakers like Priyadarshan and Sathyan Anthikkad, has left an indelible mark on Malayalam film industry

title: Delhi court dismisses Rabri Devi’s plea to transfer cases from judge alleging bias
content: Judge Vishal Gogne is currently dealing with alleged IRCTC scam, cash-for-jobs case and the money laundering proceedings associated with the family

title: PM to address first rally in Bengal on Saturday after draft roll release amid SIR concerns of Matuas
content: In the draft electoral rolls published after the enumeration phase, 58,20,899 names have been excluded, reducing the electorate to 7.08 crore

title: Off-duty Air India Express pilot assaults passenger at Delhi airport; suspended
content: The Delhi police said “The matter came to the knowledge of police through this social media post. Whenever a written complaint is received by the victim, in this regard, appropriate legal action will be taken.”

title: Now, BJD seeks reconsideration of salary hike in Odisha
content: The two major parties are of the opinion that lawmakers’ salary hike created massive public discontentment

title: Sairang-New Delhi Rajdhani Express coaches derail in Assam, 7 elephants killed
content: Five coaches and the train's engine were derailed in the incident, though no injuries to passengers were reported, a Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR) spokesperson said

title: In Kolkata, a 2026 calendar that promotes not a business but a struggle for survival
content: Last year too, a calendar had been created, for the first time, with the help of colour pictures of trams taken in the 1960s by an unknown Australian enthusiast who had passed them on to Robert D’Andrea, a former Australian tram conductor

title: Rural indebtedness rising due to unregulated microfinance institutions: Brinda Karat
content: Leading a demonstration in front of Regional Office of the RBI, Ms. Karat said, “public sector banks are giving loans to MFIs at low interest rate. They are jacking up the interest without any cap on interest rate. The SHGs and individual women are taking loan at very high rate of interest.”

title: SRMIST signs MoU with NIFTEM
content: Both the institutions will facilitate student, faculty, and staff exchange programmes and internships

title: Congress, CPI(M) leaders in Bengal say ‘rising infiltrators’ narrative of BJP proved wrong after SIR draft list
content: CPI(M) State secretary Mohammad Salim added that many vulnerable people from tribal communities, women, rented accommodation holders, street dwellers stand a chance to be omitted in the SIR process due to lack of concrete documents and should be looked into.

title: Rajasthan High Court refuses to order immediate student union elections
content: The petitioners contended that the student representation constituted a “core democratic entitlement” and the students could not be deprived of the democratic right; State government argued that the polls would disrupt academics during National Education Policy rollout

title: Govt. to launch nationwide awareness campaign on VB-G RAM G scheme
content: It will operate as a Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS), with a fund sharing pattern of 90:10 for North-Eastern and Himalayan States/UT and 60:40 for all other States; the law provides for unemployment allowance if job is not provided within 15 days, at prescribed rates, to be paid by State governments.

title: Leopard spotted in Thane, injuring several people
content: According to a Navghar police official, a few residents from Parijat housing society and some passersby were injured who were passing by on the Talav Road in Bhayandar East in the early hours

title: CIAL hands over ₹79.82 crore dividend to Kerala govt.
content: CIAL recorded the highest revenue and profit in its history during the 2024–25 financial year, achieving a total revenue of ₹1,142 crore and a net profit of ₹489.84 crore

title: Around 4,000 micro-observers to scrutinise SIR hearing process in West Bengal
content: Sources in the CEO’s office said that micro-observers will check for any discrepancies during hearings, and would report any red flags to EROs, AEROs and District Electoral Officers.

title: BJP working president Nitin Nabin meets PM Modi
content: Mr. Nabin was appointed as the BJP working president on December 14, marking a generational shift in the party; he assumed charge on December 15.

title: AI training programme for government officials to be launched
content: The Indian Institute of Technology-Madras is tying up with Google and Digital Futures Lab for the initiative

title: MMTS: Hyderabad’s overlooked lifeline waiting for a comeback
content: Daily commuters urge South Central Railway authorities to boost frequency, punctuality, and daytime services of MMTS along key suburban routes; they also point out that economical fares, eco-friendliness and coverage through dense neighbourhoods make it a ready solution

title: 200-year-old St. John Church in Secunderabad gets a makeover
content: The church has undergone extensive restoration work, including roof replacement and structural repairs, for which specialists used traditional methods and materials to preserve its heritage features; it is now ready to welcome parishioners and host Christmas celebrations

title: Down 17-0, Tide 'keep fighting' to stun Sooners
content: No. 9 seed Alabama rallied to beat No. 8 Oklahoma 34-24 in the College Football Playoff first round Friday.

title: Joshua bides time, batters Paul in sixth-round KO
content: It took longer than many predicted, but Anthony Joshua finally hunted down Jake Paul, dropping him four times in a sixth-round knockout victory Friday night.

title: Edwards returns, helps Wolves hand OKC 3rd loss
content: Anthony Edwards returned from a three-game injury absence with 26 points and 12 rebounds, hitting the go-ahead 3-pointer with 38.5 seconds left to lead the Minnesota Timberwolves past the Oklahoma City Thunder 112-107 on Friday.

title: Sources: Rockets expand talks to buy, move Sun
content: Rockets ownership is in substantive talks with the Connecticut Sun over the potential purchase and relocation of the WNBA franchise to Houston, sources told ESPN.

title: Griffin, Parker, Pearl among new HOF candidates
content: Blake Griffin, Candace Parker, Jamal Crawford, the 1996 U.S. Olympic women's basketball team, Bruce Pearl and Kelvin Sampson are among the first-time nominees for the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame.

title: Wemby blocks shot in historic 100th straight game
content: Victor Wembanyama joined an exclusive club Friday night, becoming just the third NBA player to record a block in 100 consecutive regular-season games.

title: Kobe-MJ Logoman card fetches $3.17M at auction
content: A 2003 Upper Deck Exquisite Collection dual Logoman card of Kobe Bryant and Michael Jordan sold via Heritage Auctions for $3,172,000, the seventh-most expensive basketball card sale.

title: Kraken trade Marchment to CBJ after 29 games
content: The Seattle Kraken have traded forward Mason Marchment to the Columbus Blue Jackets for two draft picks.

title: 🏈 2026 NFL draft: Five-team race for No. 1 pick
content: The Raiders, Browns, Titans, Giants and Jets are front-runners for the No. 1 pick. What would they do with the top selection?

content: Here's how each team can win its quarterfinal game, plus key players, X factors and what we learned from the first round.

title: Sights and sounds from the first round of the College Football Playoff
content: Four campuses across the country were abuzz over the weekend as the College Football Playoff came to town.

title: Our guide to every Week 16 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions and what's at stake
content: Must-win game for Lions? Can Dallas still make the postseason? We have picks, predictions and stats for every game.

content: SGA? Jokic? Cup MVP Jalen Brunson? We polled 100 media members in a ballot that mirrors the league's official vote.

title: How different is Pete Golding from Lane Kiffin? Start with social media and yoga
content: After weeks of speculation and turmoil, the Rebels and their new coach are eager to get back on the field.

content: The strategic side of baseball's next big rule change is already in motion. Here's the early thinking from MLB managers.

content: Which of the five basketball power conferences is more likely to produce this season's national champion?

title: Power Rankings: It's Arizona vs. Michigan for No. 1
content: The Wildcats and Wolverines are battling it out for the title of best team in the country. See the full top 25.

title: Did you know there are 13 active former No. 1 picks in the NFL? We examine them all
content: Matthew Stafford, Myles Garrett are having the best seasons of all 13 of the former No. 1 picks currently in the NFL.

title: Proof that Texas A&M volleyball's run is more methodical than magical
content: The Aggies reject the notion that their NCAA women's volleyball title game run is magical, or that they're riding momentum. They say it's by design.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Mbappé's quest to overtake Ronaldo, Spurs-Liverpool, more
content: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? For starters, Kylian Mbappé's quest to make Madrid history, plus the Africa Cup of Nations kicks off.

title: Want to beat the Oklahoma City Thunder? This five-step guide tells you how
content: Using the Spurs' and Trail Blazers' wins over Oklahoma City as a blueprint, let's evaluate the most important factors of a Thunder loss.

content: Here are the stories that dominated sports betting's year -- and will continue to be battlegrounds in 2026.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the College Football Playoff
content: Who takes the top spot? Our college football experts rank the top 50 players from the College Football Playoff teams.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What WNBPA's move to authorize strike means for labor talks
content: The Jan. 9 deadline is still weeks away, but the WNBPA has voted to authorize calling a strike "when necessary" during negotiations.

title: Heading into her final Olympics, Hilary Knight's impact is as big as ever
content: The 2026 Winter Olympics will be Knight's last playing for Team USA. She remains one of the faces of U.S. women's hockey.

title: Ranking the top 10 freshmen by impact
content: USC's Jazzy Davidson tops our rankings also featuring Oklahoma's Aaliyah Chavez, UConn's Blanca Quiñonez and more.

content: A disappointing end to the men's tag team championship, was emblematic of a building-block 'SmackDown.'

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari was supposed to be a dream come true, but it became a nightmare. Will 2026's regulation change make things right?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Al Hilal star Neves
content: Manchester United have been put on alert as Al Hilal midfielder Rúben Neves wants to return to the Premier League. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Risers and fallers: Add Dylan Harper, Cam Spencer for instant offense
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Govt. to increase reservation for Agniveers in CAPFs to 50%
content: After notifying the reservation of 50% constable posts in BSF, Home Ministry moves to enhance reservation in Group C posts for ex-Agniveers in other CAPFs; new policy marks a shift from government’s earlier decision

title: Kamal Haasan seeks clarification over road map for ramping up India’s nuclear power generation
content: The Rajya Sabha member recently raised two questions in Parliament related to the strategy and timeline for scaling up nuclear capacity under the Nuclear Energy Mission and the discontinuation of E10 petrol

title: Large-scale deletions reinforce AIADMK’s demand for SIR, says Edappadi Palaniswami
content: Urging electors not to panic in the event of their names having been left out of the roll, the AIADMK leader says his party will ensure that no genuine voters were omitted from the final rolls

title: Kannada Cinema Roundtable 2025: A call for consistency, originality and telling rooted stories
content: The event was held as part of The Hindu’s Lit for Life Unplugged, a precursor to the Lit for Life happening on January 17 & 18, 2026, in Chennai

title: Doctor molested while walking back home after work in Bengaluru
content: the woman had finished her shift at a private hospital and was on her way home when a man on a white scooter stopped her under the pretext of asking for directions to a bus stand

title: Health check-up finds 5.77 lakh govt. school, PU students in Karnataka have hypertension
content: Officials involved in the work cautioned that these should not be read as confirmed cases but as those that need further attention and evaluation

title: Honesty, integrity are non-negotiable in recruitment, President Murmu tells PSCs
content: Conference brings together chairpersons of the Union and State Public Service Commissions to deliberate on strengthening recruitment systems, enhancing role of PSCs in governance framework

title: DSP stabbed by couple in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada over old dispute
content: The woman had registered a case of rape against the police officer in Durg district late last year but the latter was acquitted this September

title: Haryana Assembly: No-confidence motion against BJP government defeated after Opposition stages walkout
content: In the absence of Congress MLAs, the Speaker put the motion to vote which was rejected after a five-hour debate that went on till 10.15 p.m.

title: BJP National Working President Nitin Nabin to visit Patna on December 23
content: Bihar BJP President Sanjay Saraogi said that BJP workers, along with the people of Patna and State, had been eagerly awaiting this day and now the wait is finally coming to an end.

title: Centre revises guidelines to help poor prisoners unable to pay fines, arrange sureties
content: Unhappy with the response from States and Union Territories, MHA directs jail officials to refer cases of poor prisoners and undertrials to District Legal Services Authority to facilitate release of financial assistance

title: Centre blames Opposition for stalling Parliament debate on pollution
content: As Winter Session ends, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju slams Opposition conduct and blames Congress for stalling Parliamentary debate on air pollution

title: Centre plans portal to take process of forest rights’ recognition, management online
content: Tribal Affairs Ministry said the portal is proposed to act as a single window for all Forest Rights Act processes, which include filing and processing of claims, issuing digital title deeds, storing legacy data on titles granted

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan defends IFFK against censorship and Centre’s interference
content: Pinarayi Vijayan criticises the Union Ministry of Information and Broadcasting for denying censor exemptions to 19 films, labelling the actions as a direct assault on freedom of expression and a manifestation of ‘anti-democratic’ sentiments.

title: Corporations have a fundamental duty to protect ecosystem, prevent species’ extinction: Supreme Court
content: Corporate duty must evolve from merely protecting shareholders; non-renewable power generators near the Great Indian Bustard’s habitats are “guests in its abode”, must pay for in-situ and ex-situ conservation

title: DCC strikes deal with rebel winner to retain Thiruvambady panchayat
content: Jithin Pallat, who contested from Punnakkal ward as a rebel candidate and won with a margin of 535 votes, will be offered the post of president as part of a strategic compromise

title: West Bengal BJP flags violence in Bangladesh, Trinamool hits back
content: Since August 2024, when former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina had to flee the country, the West Bengal unit of the BJP has been highlighting the alleged violence and attacks against Hindus in Bangladesh

title: RJD accuses Jitan Ram Manjhi of winning elections by vote rigging
content: A purported video of the HAM(S) leader saying he had ‘helped’ a party candidate win election has gone viral; Union Minister hits back at the Opposition, says the video had been doctored, ‘he is no longer afraid of anyone’

title: IBM to skill 5 million Indians in AI, cybersecurity, quantum computing by 2030
content: India possesses the talent and ambition to lead the world in AI & Quantum. Fluency in frontier technologies will define economic competitiveness, scientific progress and societal transformation, says IBM Chief Arvind Krishna

title: State Animal Welfare Board pushes for stricter stray dog vaccination measures in Kerala
content: The board also recommends bringing in amendments to the Kerala Panchayat Raj Act and the Kerala Municipalities Act to prevent pet dogs from being abandoned on the streets.

title: I have never been politically weak, asserts Siddaramaiah
content: Chief Minister on Thursday night had held a dinner meeting with some of his supporters in the home of Satish Jarkiholi

title: HC quashes GO allowing company to set up brewery at Elappully
content: Court observes that many aspects considered by the government while according preliminary sanction were not factually correct

title: V-C appointments gain momentum after Governor-CM talks; Opposition alleges “secret understanding”
content: Reports suggest a renewed push to make permanent appointments at all universities that have been helmed by interim V-Cs for several years

title: PM Modi's Chopper Fails To Land In Bengal Town Due To Fog, Returns To Kolkata
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to West Bengal's Nadia has been delayed due to dense fog. His helicopter returned to Kolkata airport after failing to land at the Taherpur helipad due to low visibility this afternoon.

title: Exclusive: Passenger Thrashed By Pilot Recounts What Led To The Assault
content: The SpiceJet passenger who was allegedly assaulted and left bloodied by an Air India Express pilot is struggling to come to terms with the assault that his family witnessed at the Delhi airport.

title: 5 Rajdhani Express Coaches Derail, 7 Elephants Killed After Collision In Assam
content: At least seven elephants were killed and one calf injured after a herd collided with the Sairang-New Delhi Rajdhani Express in Assam's Hojai on Saturday morning, leading to disruption of rail services.

title: "Extremely Disturbing": Priyanka Gandhi On Hindu Man's Lynching In Bangladesh
content: The lynching of a Hindu man in the ongoing unrest in Bangladesh, which happened after the death of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, has invoked strong reactions from politicians in India, with leaders raising concerns over treatment of minorities.

title: How Violence Unfolded At Bangladesh Media Offices And The Aftermath
content: Bangladesh Protests Updates: Attackers looted more than 150 computers and laptops, multiple lockers for storing money, cash, and personal belongings from the employees' desks at Prothom Alo.

title: Who Was Dipu Chandra Das, Hindu Man Lynched In Bangladesh
content: Dipu Chandra Das was lynched to death by a mob in Bangladesh's Mymensingh city on Thursday night following allegations of blasphemy, in an incident that has sparked widespread outrage.

title: Tourists Left Staring At "Nothing" As Taj Mahal Disappears Amid Heavy Fog
content: Tourists and locals were disappointed as they were unable to catch even a glimpse of the marble monument, Taj Mahal.

title: "Falsely Accused By Coworker": Taslima Nasreen On Hindu Man's Lynching In Bangladesh
content: Exiled Bangladeshi author and human rights activist Taslima Nasreen on Saturday claimed that Hindu youth Dipu Chandra Das, who was brutally killed in a mob lynching in Bangladesh, had been falsely accused of blasphemy by a Muslim coworker

title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan, Bushra Bibi Sentenced To 17 Years In Toshakhana 2 Case
content: A Pakistan accountability court on Saturday sentenced jailed former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi to 17 years imprisonment each in the Toshakhana 2 corruption case.

title: Video: Man Performs Chin-Ups While Hanging From Bridge Over Busy Highway
content: In the video, the man, dressed in dark-coloured trousers and a black vest, is seen hanging from a railway bridge that passes over the busy highway. Despite the height and the constant movement of traffic below, he performed the chin-up exercise.

title: Passenger Says Air India Express Pilot Thrashed Him, Left Him Bloodied. Airline Responds
content: A SpiceJet passenger alleged he was assaulted by an Air India Express pilot when he objected to the pilot cutting the boarding queue.

title: Bangladesh Gears Up For Anti-India Leader's Funeral Amid Violence, Arson
content: A tense Bangladesh is gearing up for the funeral of anti-India radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi amid nationwide unrest and arson by protesters seeking justice for his assassination.

title: "India Shows World That Tradition, Science Are Complementary": WHO Chief
content: World Health Organisation Director-General Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Friday underlined the need for an integrated and inclusive approach to healthcare, emphasising that science and tradition complement each other

title: How Codewords, WhatsApp Groups Exposed Coal Scam In Chhattisgarh
content: Secret codewords, WhatsApp chats, and seemingly harmless group names have emerged as the hidden language of corruption in Chhattisgarh, exposing multiple layers of power, money, and influence in the coal and liquor scams that have rocked the state.

title: "President Is Peacemaker": Marco Rubio Praises Trump For Resolving India-Pak Crisis
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio referred to the conflict between India and Pakistan that US President Donald Trump claims he resolved along with several others this year, saying the American leader "has made it a priority to be a peacemaker."

title: 8 Bills That Passed In Parliament Winter Session Amid Centre, Opposition Debate
content: Parliament passed eight bills during the relatively short winter session, with the opposition and treasury benches engaging in sharp exchanges on some of the legislations and during debates on electoral reforms and the 150th anniversary of Vande Mata

title: 'Not War But Vengeance': US Launches Massive Strikes Against ISIS In Syria
content: The US military launched airstrikes against dozens of Islamic State targets in Syria on Friday in retaliation for an attack on US personnel, US officials said on Friday.

title: Thick Smog Blankets Delhi-NCR, Over 100 Flights Cancelled, 50 Trains Delayed
content: The national capital, Delhi, woke up to a thick layer of smog blanketing the city with the Air Quality Index (AQI) at 380, falling under the 'very poor' category.

title: How A Reddit Tip-Off By "John" Helped Cops Crack US Universities' Shooting
content: Claudio Neves Valente came to the United States as an ambitious physics student at Brown University, but ended his life while hiding from police after killing two students at the Ivy League institution as well as an MIT professor.

title: Pics: PM Modi To Inaugurate India's 1st Nature-Themed Airport Terminal In Assam Today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the new terminal building of Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International (LGBI) Airport in Guwahati today. The new terminal is being billed as the largest airport terminal in Northeast India

title: Trump 'saves' Kennedy Center after 50 years of successful concerts by adding his name to it
content: the board of trustees of the John F Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington DC voted to rename the Trump-Kennedy Center . the name change was reportedly initiated by former white house personnel director and currently US ambassador to India Sergio Gor .

title: PM Modi's helicopter fails to land in Bengal's Taherpur; returns to Kolkata
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide.
